summary: Person1 asks Ms. Dawson to take a memo and tells staff that the use of Instant messaging is strictly prohibited in the office. Person1 also says any employee who persists in using Instant messaging will be placed on probation and face termination.
Person2 got stuck in traffic again. Person1 suggests Person2 start taking public transport system to work. Person2 thinks it's not good for Person2 or the environment.
Person1 tells Kate Masha and Hero are getting divorced. Kate can't believe it. Person1 says the divorce will be final early in the new year.
Person1 wishes Brian a happy birthday and dances with him at the party. Brian compliments Person1's necklace and dress. They will have a drink together to celebrate Brian's birthday.
Person1 and Person2 are in the Olympic stadium. Person2 tells Person1 the whole stadium will be finished this June.
Person1 wants to create Person1's own company. Person2 tells Person1 how to write up a business plan. Person1 thinks it's too hard and wants to stick to Person2's old job.
Person2 feels itchy and Person1 thinks Person2 has chicken pox. Person2 thinks Person1 is crazy and will take an oatmeal bath.
Person2 checks out with Person1's assistance. Person1 finds Person2 has added someone else's laundry service to Person2's bill and will correct the bill.
Person1 asks Steven for help because Person1's wife has an affair with Steven's secretary and is going to divorce Person1. Person1 promises to be faithful to his wife.
Person1 and Person2 talk about famous people of sound character, including Abraham Lincoln. They admire Lincoln for his courage and great vision.
Person1 tells Person2 the north of China is experiencing severe sandstorms. Person2 thinks the sandstorms are trouble for everybody.
Person2 gives Francis a remote car as a birthday gift at Francis's birthday party. Francis appreciates it a lot.
Tony tells Steven he feels awful because he cheated and got caught. Steven suggests Tony study hard to learn from his mistakes.
Tom tells Person1 it's time to catch the train. Person1 hurries to catch it.
Person1 asks Person2 for advice about adjusting Person1's life. Person2 suggests Person1 get plenty of sleep, do some exercise, and not drink too much.
Person1 invites Person2 to Ruojia's wedding party tonight and tells Person2 that she got married. Person2 feels surprised and will bring something to wish her happy marriage.
Person1 and Person2 are playing a game. Person1 thinks it's fun while Person2 thinks it cruel.
Mike tells Person1 his sister looks like him but is not as clever as him.
Person1 has a headache and a small fever. Person2 thinks Person1 should have called in sick.
Person1 helps Person2 buy a new mobile phone with camera and MP3 player.
Frank tells Judy he got a new job for the Post Office with a heavy work schedule and excellent health insurance benefits.
Person1 interviews Person2. Person2 tells Person1 about Person2's special skills, qualifications, special training in office skills, and experience in typing, shorthand, etc.
Person1 asks Person2 to change the steak because it's too well done and rather tough.
Person1 congratulates Tom on winning the Nobel Prize for his novel.
Person1 interviews Person2. Person2 tells Person1 Person2's major, experience, and previous work.

Person1 and Person2 talk about how much they drink. Person1 usually only has 2 beers while Person2 usually has 10 drinks all night long. Person2 advises Person1 to build up a tolerance to drinking. They plan to go to the Ram Bar and Grill tomorrow night.
Mom asks May to help her prepare for the picnic. She gives May some food and drinks and asks her to take everything to the living room.
James and Muriel Douglas meet each other for the first time. They talk about their holiday. James went to Tahoe with his family while Muriel went to L.A. with her family. They both enjoy the holiday.
Person1 wants to withdraw 10000 USD to the World Wildlife Foundation from the ATM. Person2 tells Person1 the machine is locked and the doors will remain locked until the local authorities arrive.
Person2 tells Person1 Person2 is an outgoing person and Person2's strategy in communicating with colleagues.
Mr. Polly wants to buy a bottle of soft drink from Person1, but Person1's boss is in the shop.
Monica calls Francis to ask about the time to work on the financial report. They finally agree on Friday afternoon.

Person1 is taking the interview class. Person2 tells Person1 some important considerations going into the interview, including dressing neatly and appropriately, attitude and friendliness, and always be honest with answers.

Person1 asks Mike to start from the beginning because Mike's acting hurt and sad but that's not how Person1's character would act in this situation. Mike thinks Jason would react the way most guys would, but Person1 doesn't think so.
Person1 comes to visit Mrs. Todd because Jane and Person1 had been talking about visiting her. Person1 will take his wife shopping.

Bill tells Person1 that he is tired because of working late and his brother is busy. Person1 asks Bill about his brother's work schedule. Bill's watch says 4:30 and Person1 will meet a friend at 5:30.

Simon invites Cleo to the demonstration to help stop the spread of nuclear weapons but Cleo refuses because she hates demonstrations. Simon thinks it's important to stand up for what he believes in and this will be a peaceful demonstration. Cleo advises Simon to ask the students in the political science
Person1 and Person2 think it's Person1's own fault to let people in who say 'electricity' or 'gas'.

Mark borrows Maggie's notes from the library because he works late and is tired when he comes to class. Maggie thinks Mark needs someone to study with to keep him awake and they decide to study in the library.

Person2 wants to enroll in Professor Turner's Advanced Geology course next semester. Prof. Turner tells Person2 that qualified seniors usually have a hard time to keep up but Person2 is not one of those students who are out for easy grades. Turner will speak to Professor Burman and
Person1 bought a pendant in Person2's shop but it's broken. Person2 asks Person1 to come to their shop with the receipt to change it to a new one.
Person1 is trying to talk to Person2 about Person1's new clothes while Person2 is watching a football game. Person2 asks Person1 to go and return the clothes and enjoy the game.
Person2 tells Person1 Person2 wants to work in the media. Person1 suggests several jobs but Person2 prefers interactive media.

Person1 and Person2 are at a boring speech. Person1 advises Person2 to read old newspapers with crossword puzzles in them to keep Person2 busy, but Person2 hates crosswords. Then Person1 has to pay attention to a speech.
Person1 advises Sarah to buy a house far away from the city center to save money. Person1's sister-in-law and her husband just bought a house that way and they are satisfied with it.

Person1 interviews Mark Leach, an information officer at the Britain Business Center. Mark tells Person1 he manages to meet the needs of about 500,000 visitors from overseas in a tourist information service. He is in charge of an information team that gives tourist information directly over the counter.

Lin Fang tells Lucy that English is Lin Fang's favorite subject. Lucy finds English is difficult while Nancy likes math. Lucy likes Chinese more than science while Lin Fang likes both Chinese and science.
James helps Mrs. Thomas to clean up the leaves and take her dog Oscar for a walk. James is saving up to buy a bike so he can take care of things around the house.
Person1 thinks spring is finally here but it's still cold at night. Person1 will follow Person1's cats' example and sit in the sum that shining in through the windows.

Person1 tells Mike that the feeling was all wrong between Mike and Laura. Person1 wants Mike to act hurt and sad, but Person2 thinks his reaction would be one of both anger and sadness. They will try Person1's way to see how Mike feels.
Person1 takes Person2's taxi. Person1 asks Person2 to fast the speed and pays Person2 20 yuan.
Person1 is broke and has to catch another bus. Person2 suggests Person1 get a transfer from the bus driver.
Person2 tells Person1 it takes 15 minutes to drive to downtown from their company. They have their own staff restaurant at the end of the hall.
Person1 tells Person2 Lulu and Vic broke up. Person2 didn't know they were dating.
Sally tells Dave Jim isn't available. Dave will try again later.
Person2 tells Person1 how to get to City Hall. Person1 is following Person2.

Person1 tells Person2 Person1 can't find Person1's passport. Person2 asks Person1 to fill in a lost property report and will keep an eye out for it. Person1 suggests Person2 contact the embassy and tell them about the situation.

Person1 tells Person2 Person1 was scared when Sarah said she would marry no man but Dick. Person2 thinks she doesn't care as long as he loves her.

Person1 and Person2 are at a party. Person1 thinks Person1's in love with a blond girl, but Person2 thinks she's not his cup of tea. They encourage each other to talk to other girls at the party and Person1 advises Person2 to move soon.
Jack tells Person1 he likes his poli-sci class this semester. Person1 asks Jack about his favorite class.

Person1 and Person2 are talking about the weather in Beijing. Person2 tells Person1 it rained last night and it may rain again today. They also talk about the seasons of the year and remind Person1 to put on more clothes.
Person1 and Person2 are discussing what to watch tonight. They finally decide to watch a war movie.
Adam shows Person1 around the school and introduces the tallest building, the library, the new classroom building, and the swimming pool. Person1 hopes to enter Adam's school one day.
Person1 tells Person2 that Person1 is pregnant and will have their baby soon.
Person1 and Person2 are talking about John and the girl he dates.
Person1 recommends Person2 to add a painting program to Person2's software, upgrade the hardware, and add a CD-ROM drive. Person2 thinks it's great.

James wants a dinning room but the rooms are not available now. Person1 will find a table by the window for him.
Person2 tells Person1 about the plant's size, the number of employees, the production shop, and the assembly line.

Person1 needs to make posters for a group report. Person2 and Person1 make a shopping list before going to the stationer to buy something for the posters. Person1 tells Person2 it's easy to find what Person1 needs because of the sign on top of every shelf.

Person1 wants to talk to Person2 about the sales projections for next year. Person2 is busy tomorrow morning, Friday afternoon, and Tuesday at 2:30. Person1 finally decides to meet Person2 next Tuesday.

Person2 tells Person1 the way to the school clinic.
Person2 asks Person1 to change her room because the room is too noisy. Person1 apologizes and promises to change the room for her tomorrow. Person2 is grateful.

Person1 drives Person2 to the Beijing hotel and tells Person2 about the service of the hotel. Mr. Wu invites Person1 to the banquet in honor of Person2 in the evening. Person1 will arrange some sightseeing for Person2.
Person2 shows Person1 the way to Liu Ichang, a Chinese antique store. Person1 is lost and Person2 tells Person1 how to get there.
Person2's computer stops running and Person1 cannot solve the problem. Person1 suggests Person2 ring up the repairmen.
Person2 is looking for a birthday gift for Person2's mother. Person1 recommends a gold watch with big, clear numbers. Person2 will take it.

Person1 and Person2 take some grapes and some apples for the picnic.
Person2 tells Person1 the information about renting an economy car.
Person1 and Person2 are talking about the reasons why people smile. Person1 is fed up with those who keep smiling while Person2 thinks it means Person1 likes them.

Person1 and Person2 are talking about the good news that their company has started making money again and their growth this year. They think the company's performance has improved since Wallace became president and they have become the top sellers in the field.
Person2 lost Person2's backpack. Person1 drives Person2 home and lends Person2 some money to fix it. Person2 will take a bus home and ask for some money from mom.

Lin thanks Steven for the meal in Beijing and asks Steven about tipping in China. Steven tells Lin there's no tipping in hotels and restaurants and cab drivers and porters don't accept gratuities, but in first-class hotels they're instructed not to accept gratis.
Bill tells Person1 he's happy because he made a move with his roommate Brain Locker. Person1 asks Bill about his roommate.
Person2 helps Tom Wilson to pay the bill. Tom pays by credit card.
Carol tells Susan the party is tomorrow night at 8:30 at Jills House. Susan asks Carol to tell Carol to bring a dessert.
Person1 thinks she knows Person2 from somewhere but Person2 doesn't recognize her at first. Then Person1 realizes she has met Person2 before.
Person1 and Person2 are talking about who they voted for. Person2 trusts in Donald Trump while Person1 doesn't. Person1 will vote for Joe Biden.
Person2 shows Person1 how to use the ATM.
Susan Miller calls John to ask for a copy of the memo.
Person1 invites Lily to a picnic this weekend. Person1 suggests going to the river and having supper.

Person1 asks Person2 to contact Person1 when Person1's organization will make a decision.

Person2 will help Person1 to put the curtain up.
Person1 asks Jack to check the calendar for a camping trip.

Person2 refuses Person1's invitation to John's house tonight because Person2 thinks Person2's getting sick. Person1 suggests Person2 stay at home and rest.

Person1 and Person2 enjoyed their weekend. Person1 invites Person2 to Changsha again.

Person1 tells Person2 Person2 will be reported to the police if Person2 calls Person1 again.

Person2 is going to set up Person2's own law office. Person1 wishes Person2 every success.
Peter tells Kate he was online the whole night and needs a rest.
Person1 and Person2 talk about the decline of ships and boats in transportation. Person1 says most of the transoceanic cargo transportation is still carried by boat.

Person2 tells David about Person2's plans for the vacation. Person2 will start out from Long Island this Friday and will join David's brother and his family in Salt Lake City. They will spend the nights in hotels and enjoy local food.

Person2 tells Person1 the bus station is on the seventy-third street and Person1 can walk there.

Person1 invites Person2 to go to London by train next week. Person2 prefers to go by car, but Person1 prefers the train. They will never agree on this subject.

Person1 helps Person2 order a double cheeseburger, some large curly fries, a medium Pepsi, and a drink.

Person1 wants to take a picture of Person2 to show Person1's children how an American policeman looks.
Person2 asks Person1 for a room for tomorrow. Person1 tells Person2 the Sunset Hotel is three blocks away.

Anne tells Person2 she's going to bed early because she didn't have a good time with Person2 last time. Person2 wants a second chance but Anne refuses.

Person1 asks Person2 about American-styled accounting. Person2 introduces the most fundamental concepts underlying the accounting process.
Jane invites Peter to Xi'an in the summer. Peter is interested and they talk about the details of going there. They also talk about where to go for a holiday.

Person2 tells Person1 the airport is closed and they will stay in the airport hotel for the night.
Person1 wants to repay the favor to Person2. Person2 agrees to go Dutch.

Person2 schedules an appointment for Person1 to get Person1's test results from the other day. Person1 is worried that something is wrong with Person1. Person2 will talk about it this afternoon.

John asks Susan to look after his cousin who is coming to the college campus this weekend. Susan will show her around during the day and they will meet for dinner later. Susan also tells John there is a music festival in the auditorium. John will drop her off at Susan's place

Person1 and Ben are looking at the information about the evening classes Person1 sent off for. They talk about the general courses, including flower arranging, photography, Indian cooking, and web design. Person1 will call Ben to see if there are still spaces available.
Person1 and Person2 are discussing where to eat. They finally decide to go to the Carrots tomorrow evening.
Gene tells Person1 that he will take the driving test because he is taking a job in Los Angeles and has to drive. Gene has picked out the car he wants and it has some safety features.
Person1 buys a pen with Person2's assistance.

Person2 tells Person1 Person2's company's fundraiser events went well. They were able to sponsor a marathon for the American Cancer Society and raise several thousand dollars. Person2 thinks it's a great deal for both charities and the company.
Person2 tells Person1 the way to the Peak Tram. Person1 will write it down.
Person2 wants to see some traditional Chinese arts and crafts. Person1 recommends a sandalwood fan and Person2 buys two small ones and a big one.
Person2 tells Person1 the main external factors and internal factors that influence the company.
Person1 wants to bring everybody back on this subject. Person2 suggests a preparatory meeting this afternoon. Person1 will come by at around 3:00.
Person2 asks Person1 for a short tour. Person1 recommends a one-day trip along the river.
Person2 orders a beef-burger, a French fry, a milk shake, and a banana shake with Person1's assistance.

Person1 and Person2 are enjoying the Lantern Festival. Person2 tells Person1 the characters on the lanterns are puzzles and Person1 can't read Chinese characters. They see a huge dragon lantern spewing fireworks. Person1 finds there are Chinese poems on its body.
Person1 tells Tina Person1 has successfully passed the first two rounds of interviews and will go for a celebration this evening.
Tim and Karren say goodbye to each other.

Person1 tells Person2 they're having a department meeting at 10. Person2 will pick up some stationary from Julie and Person1 will show Person2 the way to the photocopier. Person1 enjoys working in this office.
Person1 asks Person2 to tell Person1 how to use the buttons to take a bath.
Person2 recommends a novel written by a famous Japanese novelist to Person1 for killing time on the train.
Person1 asks Person2 to teach Person1's 78-year-old friend how to read. Person1 thinks Person2 is great at teaching and will love the boy.
Person1 picks up Person1's ticket with Person2's assistance.

Person1 invites Person2 to make dinner together. Person2 refuses because Person2 thinks frozen pizza is bad for Person2. Person1 suggests trying a piece of spicy chicken curry and teaches Person2 how to cook it.
Person2 tells Person1 how to use the IC phone and the coin phone. Person1 will try both of them.
Person2 tells Person1 EDD has special services to help Person1 with Person1's job search, including callous, information, workshops, and job fairs.
Tom tells Person1 the second-hand goods are not as good as the new ones and advises Person1 to be careful buying them.

Person1 asks Morgan whether Chinese people take their leftover food home from a restaurant. Morgan says they usually go to the dump. Morgan tells Person1 ordering a lot of food at restaurants is a tradition in China. Person1 thinks it would make more sense to take the leftovers home.

Harry tells Person2 he got ripped off at a street market in China. Person2 thinks it's because Harry ignored the procedure of bargaining in business deals and advises Harry to consult the price tags in the supermarket first.
Person1 asks Person2 about Person2's proficiency in English. Person2 tells Person1 Person2 has been studying English since junior high school and majored in English in college.

Person2 wants to open up a new checking account and a savings account with Person1's assistance. Person1 tells Person2 the account comes with cards that can be used in ATM machines and the maximum amount of overdraft is $1000. Person2 will receive the cards and pin numbers
Person2 tells Person1 how to get special discount coupons. Person1 will take 9 bags of sugar and get 3 coupons.
Mrs. Robinson thanks Steve for looking after Johnny and cleaning the kitchen.

S M I T H tells Person1 that he lost his train ticket to Shanghai. Person1 asks for his last name, passport number, and tells him he needs to purchase another ticket. Person2 buys a soft sleeper ticket with Person1's assistance.

Ann tells Person1 that she did the well-being in the air program on the flight to the States and she didn't have a problem with jet lag on the way back. Ann also shares her experience of drinking water, eating lighter, and doing exercises on the plane. Person1
Mary tells Tom she has found a job at McDonald's. Tom tells her her father's company needs some people to work for the summer and will tell her father about it.
Harry tells Person1 he was almost hit by a car. Person1 hopes Harry can report the driver to the police. Harry won't cross the street reading the newspaper.

Mr. Kayne tells Person1 why he wants to run his bicycle shop. He says he always loved racing bikes and fixed them, so he had a heart set on starting his own business. He doesn't keep regular hours and has hired some friends to work with him.
Ethel and Person2 are arguing about whether they are middle-aged or not. Ethel thinks they are on the edge of middle while Person2 says they are not.
Person2 thinks the meal was perfect and wants to split something with Person2's friends. Person1 recommends apple crisps, a piece of chocolate mousse cake, and four teas to Person2.

Person1 and Person2 are discussing where to put the speakers. They decide to use Person2's stereo and Person1 gets the bottom bunk. Person2 wants the desk by the window. Person1 thinks it would be more fair so they decide to start unpacking.
Mr. Murray wants to get a library card. Person2 asks him to fill out an application and tells him the rules and limitations.

Person2 tells Person1 about Person2's typical 9-to-5 job. Person2 gets a bonus depending on the value of the contracts Person2 signs with clients. Person1 doesn't like working in a cubicle but Person2 doesn't mind it.

Nick asks Alice how to use the washing machines. Alice tells Nick it's easy to put quarters in the machines, but Nick has never washed clothes before. Nick tells Alice he has to buy some soap from the vending machine to wash clothes. Alice asks Nick how he will survive in this
Person1 and Person2 are both busy with work. Person1 will call Person2 tonight.
Person1 gives Katie an evaluation. Person1 thinks Katie is always available to work but has arrived late several times and is always willing to do something even when not having customers.

Person1 and Person2 are planning a surprise birthday party for grandpa. They decide to have it at their house because it's too cold to have a garden party at the hotel. They talk about the food, drink, and gift they will give grandpa and decide to do it
Gina and Robert introduce themselves to each other at a conference. Gina invites Robert to meet her friend who works for an Italian service provider.
Person2 tells Kathy that this is the year of the 17-year bird calls in the North Carolina Mountains. Kathy thinks the sounds are so noisy that she doesn't want to walk under the trees.
Person2 orders a turkey sandwich, a salad, and a diet coke at Danny's restaurant.

James tells Person1 he's almost finished packing and is waiting for the jacket he lent to David. Person1 advises James to take the cookies made for James's grandparents with him. James will take them.
Ted's wife will stay at her parents' while Person1 will spend a few weeks in China with Person1's husband.
Person1 asks Person1's dad whether they should go to the cinema this afternoon. Person2 tells Person1 the film is No Country for Old Men and they will go to McDonald's.
Person2 tells Person1 Person2's house was robbed last night.
Jack invites Charlie to play a new video game. Charlie agrees after Charlie finishes his homework. Jack introduces the game to Charlie.

Person2 tells Person1 Person2 got interested in country music when Person2 and his wife first caught their record player. Person2 started buying country song books and building Person2's own library to find information.

Alice tells Person1 how to use the washing machines. Person1 has never washed clothes before and Person1 tells Alice Person1's mother always did it. Alice's mother started washing clothes herself when Person1 was 12. Alice suggests Person1 buy some soap but Person1 doesn't have
Steve tells Matthew he's been looking for a place to live recently. Matthew's neighbor, Mrs. Thou, invites Steve to have a look at her apartment. Steve thinks it would be nice to be neighbors again.
Frank invites Betsy to his promotion party because he hopes there will be 150 people there. Betsy thinks it would be a great time and can't wait to go.
